name: Seahorse
movement: swim 20 ft., cannot move on land
description: A tiny aquatic creature with unique adaptations for underwater living, capable of swimming but not moving on land.
memorable: Exceptional at camouflage while submerged, making it difficult for predators to detect.
goals: Survive in aquatic habitats and evade predation.
relations: Often found in marine ecosystems, may reside among seaweed or coral.
environment: Aquatic environments such as oceans, seas, or coral reefs.
weaknesses: Very low hit points, weak physical attributes, cannot survive outside water.
attacks: Melee attack called 'Ram' dealing minimal bludgeoning damage.
most_powerful_ability: Water Breathing, allowing it to breathe only underwater.
additional_information: Not a combatant, primarily serves as a whimsical representation of marine life.
Low strength and intelligence scores reflect lack of physical power and cognitive ability.
Stealth score of 17 while submerged enhances its survival tactics.
Natural armor provides minimal protection but is still quite fragile.
Plays a role in adding flavor to aquatic ecosystems in campaigns.
test_queries: stealthy underwater creature with water breathing
camouflaged seahorse found in coral reefs
minuscule marine beast with ram attack
creature that can only breathe water
